verses.text: Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*: For \add it is\add* good to sing \add praises\add* unto our God; For \add it is\add* pleasant; \add and\add* praise is comely.
The \sc Lord\sc* doth build up Jerusalem: He gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.
He healeth the broken in heart, And bindeth up their wounds.
He telleth the number of the stars; He calleth them all \add by their\add* names.
Great \add is\add* our Lord, and of great power: His understanding \add is\add* infinite.
The \sc Lord\sc* lifteth up the meek: He casteth the wicked down to the ground.
Sing unto the \sc Lord\sc* with thanksgiving; Sing \add praise\add* upon the harp unto our God:
Who covereth the heaven with clouds, Who prepareth rain for the earth, Who maketh grass to grow \add upon\add* the mountains.
He giveth to the beast his food, \add And\add* to the young ravens which cry.
He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: He taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.
The \sc Lord\sc* taketh pleasure in them that fear him, In those that hope in his mercy.
Praise the \sc Lord\sc*, O Jerusalem; Praise thy God, O Zion.
For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; He hath blessed thy children within thee.
He maketh peace \add in\add* thy borders, \add And\add* filleth thee \add with\add* the finest of the wheat.
He sendeth forth his commandment \add upon\add* earth: His word runneth very swiftly.
He giveth snow like wool: He scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.
He casteth forth his ice like morsels: Who can stand before his cold?
He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: He causeth his wind to blow, \add and\add* the waters flow.
He sheweth his word unto Jacob, His statutes and his judgments unto Israel.
He hath not dealt so with any nation: And \add as for his\add* judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*.
